page.title: 13NATIONAL POLITICS
page.content:
Renfrew lies in the constituency of Paisley North. Until the boundary changes of 1983 it lay in East Renfrewshire. It is represented by Allen Adams, a member of the Labour Party. Renfrew is a traditionally strong Labour area but with the increase in owner-ocupation this is changing. The 1983 Election results were: Allen Adams (LAB) 15,782 Eileen McCartin (ALL) 8,195 Brian Townsend (CON) 7,425 H.Morrell (SNP) 2,783
The current issues affecting Renfrew are Youth Unemployment, the redundancy threats at Babcock Power and adult unemployment. The rates revaluation (see p12) occurred only in Scotland and has become a focus of protest from supporters of all parties in Scotland.
